definition: to rely on/to depend on
surname Yang
to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on
weaponry/to hold (a weapon)/to wield/to rely on/to depend on/war/battle

sentences.english: Our victory depends very materially upon his perceptive power.
sentences.chinese: 我方的胜利极大地仰仗着他的洞察能力。

sentences.english: Her heritage, as the daughter of Aung San, Myanmar’s independence hero, was always in her favour.
sentences.chinese: 身为缅甸独立运动英雄昂山的女儿，能够仰仗父荫。

sentences.english: “Fairtrade rests as much on market forces as conventional trading does,” he writes.
sentences.chinese: “公平贸易与传统贸易一样仰仗市场力量，”他写道。

sentences.english: Israel can rely on God, just as a vassal can rely on his suzerain.
sentences.chinese: 犹太人可以仰仗上帝，就像奴隶可以依靠领主。

sentences.english: Whoever you are, I have always depended on the kindness of strangers.
sentences.chinese: 不管你是谁，我总仰仗着陌生人的仁慈。

sentences.english: As political officers, I'm counting on you.
sentences.chinese: 作为政治官员，我可全仰仗着你们了。

sentences.english: He referred himself to his father's power and influence.
sentences.chinese: 他仰仗着他父亲的权势。

definition: to lean on/to rely on
to count on/to rely on
to rely on sb for support
to rely heavily upon
to rely on/to be dependent on
to help/to assist financially
to take care/to keep an eye on/to look after/to tell/to remind
to depend on/to rely on
(lit.) to hold sb by the elbow/(fig.) to hold back/to impede/to handicap
to lead by the hand/to guide/to support
to claim credit for oneself
were it not for/if not for
to rely on/to depend on
to rely on others for the air one breathes (idiom); to depend on sb's whim for one's living
to rely on sb for protection
to control/to dominate/to monopolize
